title: Street, Somerset
summary: Street is a large village and civil parish in Somerset, England, with a population of 11,805 in 2011.[1] On a dry spot in the Somerset Levels, at the end of the Polden Hills, it is 2 miles (3.2Â km) south-west of Glastonbury. There is evidence of Roman occupation. Much of the history of the village is dominated by Glastonbury Abbey, and a 12th-century causeway from Glastonbury built to transport local Blue Lias stone to it.
